intro: Phlogacanthus asperulus, commonly known as the rough phlogacanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough or hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or forest understories.
